About Y2K Aesthetic Insurance

Y2K Aesthetic Insurance provides comprehensive coverage for the emotional, technological, and existential damages incurred by exposure to 21st-century reality. Founded in 2024 by Tiffany Chung and Kevin Nguyen following a catastrophic virtual pet loss event (Incident Report #TPC-2024-0301), Y2K Aesthetic Insurance is committed to safeguarding your millennial vibes against the harsh realities of modern existence.


We believe that every corrupted floppy disk tells a story. That every dead Tamagotchi deserves a eulogy. That the screeching handshake of a 56k modem was, in its own way, a kind of music. Our policies don't just cover losses — they validate them.

kevvy cried too but won't admit it — T

§ COVERAGE PLANS

Floppy Disk Recovery Add-On (Policy §4.2.1)

Professional data recovery services for corrupted 3.5" and 5.25" floppy disks, Zip drives (100MB and 250MB), and Jaz cartridges. Coverage includes electromagnetic degradation, fungal contamination, and "that thing where the metal slider gets stuck."

Disclaimer: Compatibility with pre-1995 storage methods validated on a case-by-case basis by our Senior Archivist (Debra, part-time).

Deductible: $19.99

Tamagotchi Trauma Coverage (Policy §7.1.0)

Emotional distress coverage for the loss of virtual pets including but not limited to: Tamagotchi (all generations), Neopets, Digimon, and unlicensed LCD keychain pets. Covered conditions: Digital Attachment Disorder (DAD), Phantom Feeding Syndrome, and Recursive Guilt Loop.

Claimants are eligible for up to 6 sessions with our Virtual Grief Counselor.

Join the support group →

Deductible: $24.99

Dial-Up Downtime Compensation (Policy §3.8.4)

Partial refund compensation for verified internet downtime experienced by customers maintaining active dial-up connections. Claims require submission of speed test screenshots (minimum resolution: 640x480) and a signed affidavit confirming non-possession of broadband alternatives.

Compensation rate: $0.003/minute of documented downtime.

Deductible: $0.00 (we owe you)
I can still hear the sound. sometimes I play it to fall asleep. — T

Screen Burn-In Protection (Policy §5.5.2)

CRT monitor burn-in coverage for damage caused by prolonged display of static images including but not limited to: AIM buddy icons, WinAmp skins, desktop wallpapers (tiled), and that one screensaver you left on during a two-week family vacation in 1998.

Acceptable ghosting levels defined per Appendix C (not included in this document).

Deductible: $14.99

Napster Nightmare Legal Defense (Policy §9.0.1)

Legal representation for copyright infringement claims arising from peer-to-peer file-sharing activities conducted between 1999–2003. Coverage extends to Napster, LimeWire, Kazaa, Morpheus, and BearShare.

Note: Policy does not cover liability for files labeled "System_Of_A_Down_Toxicity.mp3.exe".

Deductible: $99.99
I had 4,000 songs. deleted them all in one night. still think about it. — T

Retro Router Replacement Program (Policy §11.3.0)

Replacement of WEP-encrypted routers with period-appropriate but secure alternatives. Replacement units ship in authentic late-90s packaging (factory-sealed shrink wrap, 47-page paper manual, driver CD included).

Allow 6–8 weeks for delivery via ground shipping.

Deductible: $34.99

§ FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

From: desperate_millennial_42@hotmail.com To: claims@y2kaesthetic.biz Subject: Re: Re: Re: Fwd: Y2K fear

Will my policy cover therapy for my fear of Y2K happening… again?

Y2K Aesthetic Insurance recognizes Y2K Recurrence Anxiety (Y2KRA) as a covered condition under Policy §12.0.0. However, we must note that Y2K did, in fact, happen. The world simply elected to become worse gradually rather than all at once.

From: beaniequeen99@aol.com To: claims@y2kaesthetic.biz Subject: Re: Fwd: Re: beanie coverage???

Does "millennial vibe" include my extensive Beanie Baby collection?

Beanie Babies fall under our Speculative Nostalgia Assets rider (additional $4.99/mo). Please note that Princess Diana Bear claims are processed by a separate department and require a 90-day cooling period.

From: cant_stop_listening@yahoo.com To: claims@y2kaesthetic.biz Subject: Re: Re: Re: Re: Fwd: URGENT dial up sound

I can't stop listening to the dial-up sound on YouTube. Is this an emergency?

If you are experiencing an active nostalgia event, please remain calm and do not attempt to open Netscape Navigator. Our 24/7 helpline (1-800-Y2K-HELP) is staffed by trained professionals who also miss the internet.

From: redacted@y2kaesthetic.biz To: all-staff@y2kaesthetic.biz Subject: Re: Re: Fwd: Re: What happened to Kevin?

Kevin Nguyen departed Y2K Aesthetic Insurance in 2027 to pursue opportunities in the metaverse insurance sector. His policy has been terminated. We wish him well. [This answer has been reviewed by Legal.]

Y2K AESTHETIC INSURANCE CO. — TERMS AND CONDITIONS — DOCUMENT REF: YAI-2024-001-Rev.3 — ALL RIGHTS RESERVED (AS IF THAT MEANS ANYTHING ANYMORE)

Y2K Aesthetic Insurance makes no guarantees regarding the restoration of your 1999 self. The person you were when you first heard "Steal My Sunshine" on a car radio cannot be recovered through commercial means. All policies are subject to the fundamental limitation that time moves in one direction and nostalgia is not a place you can live. By accepting these terms you acknowledge that what you are actually insuring is not your technology but your memory of a future that was promised and never delivered. Coverage begins at the moment you realize this and does not expire.

Pursuant to the Year 2000 Information and Readiness Disclosure Act (Pub.L. 105–271), Y2K Aesthetic Insurance discloses that its systems were never Y2K compliant and remain non-compliant as a matter of principle. Policyholders assume all risk associated with the continued forward motion of time. No refunds. No returns. No going back. You already knew that.

This document was last printed on a dot matrix printer on 12/28/1999 and has not been updated since because honestly what would be the point. The margins are wrong because Debra's printer always did that and we never fixed it. If you're reading this you've scrolled further than 97% of our policyholders and you should probably go outside, but we understand why you won't.
